title: Purse, 1640–1700
medium:
Medium: silk, gold-wrapped silk (ID: Lab)
Technique: tapestry woven
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Small purse of deep rose silk with a pattern in greenish-white, shot with metal. Pattern is a symmetrical arrangement of a crown in the center with highly stylized vine forms. Same pattern front and back. Purse is an envelope shape with a silk loop and button to fasten. Blue taffeta lining.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, 1640–1700.
1640–1700. Medium: silk, gold-wrapped silk (ID: Lab)
Technique: tapestry woven. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-55-4.
